solution_line_template: Greg and Sarah will split their apples, so {total_apples_to_split} apples / {num_children_splitting} = <<{total_apples_to_split}/{num_children_splitting}={apples_per_child}>>{apples_per_child} apples per child.

Combined the children have {apples_per_child} apples + {apples_per_child} apples + {susan_apples} apples + {mark_apples} apples = <<{apples_per_child}+{apples_per_child}+{susan_apples}+{mark_apples}={total_children_apples}>>{total_children_apples} apples.
Mom will have {total_children_apples} apples - {mom_needs_apples} apples = <<{total_children_apples}-{mom_needs_apples}={apples_left_over}>>{apples_left_over} apples left over.
